comments:
I have an editor which want to have another view open when it is opened. So, in 
init(), I call site.getPage().showView(VIEW_ID);

This works when the editor is opened, but when restarting the workbench, it 
throws a PartInitException when the editor is reopened as part of restoring the 
workbench.
Can you post the stack please?

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-05-18 22:18:32.565

Interesting. Editors are currently restored before the first perspective is
open. This sounds like another good reason to open the active perspective before
the editor area.

Since the perspective was around when the workbench was shut down, it makes
sense that it should still be there on restart (if possible).

Also, this error should be reported as "no perspectives open", not "Abnormal
Workbench Condition"

However, the editor itself should not be assuming the existence of a
perspective. If the purpose is to bring a view forward whenever the editor is
revealed, it may be a better idea to call showView in a visibility listener
rather than on part creation. Otherwise it should probably just fail quietly if
unable to create the view since the view would be restored anyway when the
perspective is restored.

The editor is just asking the page to show a view. There's reference to 
perspectives in the editor.

Oops. I guess I misread the stack trace. I thought that failure to create the
view was also causing the editor to fail to be created.

Is this still a problem in 3.3?

PW
